defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: This collection consists of photocopies of three documents in part of 1 Hollinger box (1 folder).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Debra S. Clatterbuck Collection, Collection #2083, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Debra S. Clatterbuck signed a depository agreement November 11, 1989; that agreement was terminated Oct. 31, 2001, with photocopies remaining at the Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photocopies of three documents relevant to the settling of the estate of Michael Henkle of Pendleton County. Two documents date from 1861: one specifies the monetary conditions for the sale of Henkle's belongings, the other for the sale of Henkle's slaves. The third document, dated 1866, is a receipt from the Pendleton County clerk apparently to settle the estate record.
